citation.article-title: Desulfoglaeba alkanexedens gen. nov., sp. nov., an n-alkane-degrading, sulfate-reducing bacterium.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Desulfoglaeba (De.sul.fo.glaeâ€²ba. L. prep. de from; N.L. sulfo used for fem. n. sulfas sulfate in genus names of sulfate-reducing prokaryotes; L. fem. n. glaeba clump/crumb/aggregate; N.L. fem. n. Desulfoglaeba sulfate-reducing clump/aggregate).
Mesophilic, sulfate-reducing bacteria that tend to form clusters.
Cells are oval rods with refractile cores.
Strictly specialized in their substrate specificity.
The type species is Desulfoglaeba alkanexedens.
